page.title: 08ALDERNEY HOSPITAL
page.content: The Hospital lies on the western edge of the area. It specializes in elderly people. Nurses go their homes or they are taken care of in one of the four wards available. Alderney was built in 1888 and is called Alderney because of a road of that name nearby. There are 4 in-patient wards and 2 day wards. In each ward there are 28 beds. The total number of patients are 97 in the in-patient wards and 35 in the two day wards. There are 14 male staff and 94 female staff. They also have 4 community nurses taking care of 50 patients each. Alderney also employs part-time workers, catering in the main kitchen or nursing. The Hospital covers three areas; Poole, Wimborne and the Purbeck.
